qas.question: In what year was "The Essence of Christianity" written?
What did the author of "The Essence of Christianity" consider religion to be?

answers.text: the outward projection of man's inward nature

qas.question: The author's ideas would later influence what well known philosopher?
What German materialist did not signal a new turn in materialism?
Karl Marx was not influenced by who?
When did Karl Marx write The Essence of Christianity?

context: The German materialist and atheist anthropologist <a0_0><b4_0><b7_0>Ludwig Feuerbach<b7_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/> would signal a new turn in materialism through his book, The Essence of Christianity (<a1_0><b5_0><b6_0><b8_0>1841<b8_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/>), which provided a humanist account of religion as <a2_0>the outward projection of man's inward nature<a2_0/>. Feuerbach's materialism would later heavily influence <a3_0>Karl Marx<a3_0/>.
